nodes.text: Fibroblast medium:DMEM, 10% Fetal Bovine Serum, 1% Nonessential amino acids, 1mM GlutaMAX, 1% Penicillin-streptomycin, 55μM 2- mercaptoethanol  and 1mM sodium pyruvate
Medium 106:Add 10ml of LSGS to 500ml medium 106 basal; supplement with 1% Pen-strep.

In vitro culture 1 (IVC1) medium:Advanced DMEM/F-12, 1% ITS-X supplement, 2mM L-Glutamine, 0.5% Penicillin-streptomycin, 20% Fetal Bovine Serum, 25 μM N-acetyl-L-cysteine, 8 nM β-estradiol and 200 ng/ml progesterone

Human iBlastoid medium:2:1:1 mixture of IVC1 medium, iBlastoid basal medium 1 [50:50 mixture of DMEM/F-12 and Neurobasal medium, supplemented with 2mM L-Glutamine, 0.1mM 2-mercaptoethanol, 0.5% N2 supplement, 1% B27 supplement, 1% Penicillin-streptomycin] and iBlastoid basal medium 2 [DMEM/F-12, GlutaMAX supplemented with 0.3% BSA, 0.2% FBS, 1% ITS-X supplement, 0.1mM 2-mercaptoethanol, 0.5% Penicillin-streptomycin, 1.5 μg/ml L-ascorbic acid] supplemented with 2 μM CHIR99021, 0.5 μM A83-01, 1 μM SB431542, 0.8 mM Valproic acid, 50 ng/ml EGF and 10ng/ml BMP4
cells are to be thawed quickly at 37ºC and then pelleted at 200xg for 5 minutes.
Resuspend the cell pellet in 10 ml of 106 medium supplemented with LSGS and plated into a T75 flask.
Culture the cells in a 37ºC, 5% O2 and 5% CO2 incubator for expansion. Media are changed every other day and cultures split at a 1:3-1:5 ratio using Trypsin/EDTA Solution (TE) upon confl uency.
seed the cells at a density of ~5-10x104 cells per well of a 12-well plate in fi broblast medium
For cryo-preservation, freeze cells in 90% FBS with 10% DMSO

After 36 hours, transduce the attached primary HDFa with Sendai viruses in fibroblast medium at the multiplicity of infection (MOI) as follows, KOS MOI=5, c-MYC MOI=5, KLF4 MOI=6 in 500 μl of fi broblast medium per well. The cells are cultured in a 37ºC, 5% O2 and 5% CO2 incubator. day 0 is Sendai virus transduction .
After 24 hours(day 1), perform a media replacement with 1 ml/well of fresh and warmed fibroblast medium.

Perform a media replacement every other day from day 1 of transduction. Starting from day 8 onwards when the reprogramming cells are becoming highly proliferative, daily media replacement with 2 ml/well of fibroblast medium is required.
On day 21 of reprogramming, the cells would be ready for the generation of iBlastoids
Add 500 μL of Anti-Adherence Rinsing Solution (Stem cell technologies) into each well of the AggreWell 400 24-well plate to be used and centrifuge the plate at 1300xg for 5 minutes.

Ensure that no air bubbles are present after centrifugation and subsequently aspirate the rinsing solution from the wells. Perform an additional rinsing step with warmed basal medium, then add 1mL of Human iBlastoid medium supplemented with Y-27632 into each well. Place the plate in the incubator.
aspirate the spent medium and perform a washing step with DPBS.
Aspirate the DPBS and add 500 μl of TrypLE Express Enzyme into each well
Place the plate back into the incubator for 5 minutes
After 5 minutes, gently pipette the contents in each well to ensure that they have been well dissociated
Add 500 μL of fi broblast medium to stop the enzymatic reaction.
Collect the cellular contents into a conical tube and centrifuge at 500xg for 3 minutes.
Aspirate the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet in appropriate volume of Human iBlastoid medium supplemented with Y-27632 for cell counting.
Perform a cell count on the collected cells and dilute accordingly to a cell concentration of 1.2x105 cells/ml with Human iBlastoid medium supplemented with Y-27632
Take the prepared AggreWell plate out from the incubator and transfer 1 mL of well mixed cell suspension into each well of the plate.
Centrifuge the plate at 100xg for 3 minutes to capture the cells at the bottom of microwells.
Observe the plate under the microscope to confi rm that cells have been evenly distributed among the microwells.
Carefully transfer the plate back to the 37ºC, 5% O2 and 5% CO2 incubator.
24 hours later, carefully perform a media replacement with warmed Human iBlastoid medium without Y-27632.
On day 6 of iBlastoid formation in the AggreWell, the iBlastoids would be clearly visible and could be collected into a 15 mL conical tube
Let the iBlastoids in the conical tube to sediment for 5-10 minutes and carefully aspirate the majority of the supernatant to remove most of the cell debris.
Transfer the sedimented iBlastoids into a 60 mm TC-treated Cell Culture Dish (Corning) fi lled with 3 mL of Human iBlastoid medium.
Using a dissection microscope, carefully pick the cavitated iBlastoids for subsequent analysis.
